NOW OPEN @ GPS

Paid Parking
Exhibition by Kate Robinson & Heidi Zenisek

On View February 10-14, 2026
Reception: Friday, Feb 13th | 6-8p

Gallery Open Hours:
Tuesday - Friday, 12-5p
Saturday, 2-5p

Run, donâ€™t walk, to Icelandâ€™s hottest new attraction. If youâ€™ve never been to Gjaldskylda, youâ€™re missing out! At least thatâ€™s what the hundreds of tourists tagging it on social media would like you to think. What is it, you ask? A parking lot. More specifically, itâ€™s a parking lot that requires payment. Iceland has a specific online identity, carefully crafted by the Icelandic Tourism Board. The Land of Fire and Ice, renewable energy, Northern lights, geothermal spasâ€¦ but as a trip to Gjaldskylda will illustrate, social media can be deceiving.

What is Iceland beyond the oversaturated Instagram photos of waterfalls and TikTok drone footage of mountains? This exhibition is a collection of works that inadvertently explore this question. Heidi and Kate have had transformative experiences in Iceland over the years, returning time after time to recharge their creative batteries and weave themselves into the culture. Upon return home, moments of these trips find their way into their practices. This show is the result of their curiosity about the overlaps in their work inspired by Iceland and how their similar experiences have manifested in different ways.

Learn more by clicking â€œHappening Nowâ€ in the Linktree above in our profile

events.title: ğŸ¨ American Pony Opening Reception
events.description:
Thank you to everyone who joined us for the reception of American Pony by Constantine Kerasilis.ğŸâœ¨

Sadly we are closed today due to weather â„ï¸, so your chance to see this exhibition has passed, BUT we will be back to usual programming next week with yet another show!

************************
Gallery Open Hours:
Tuesday - Friday, 12-5p
Saturday, 2-5p

American Pony is a group of work consisting of paintings, drawings, prints, and sculpture focused on the psychology of Americans under the rise of fascism. Simplified and abstracted within the metaphor of tortured ponies, this series is autobiographical in nature. Each work weighs morals, dreams, fears, self perception, and unity amongst Americans over the course of 2025. Specifically the year that changed countless lives affected by American politics and social climate. The world as I know it rapidly changes, for better or worse, these ponies are saturated in analogies to process change, they represent me and reflections of myself I see in so many others. Viewers are invited to think of themselves as I bear my mind for all to see and explore the complexities of their own mentality.

Learn more by clicking â€œHappening Nowâ€ in the Linktree above in our profile

New Semester = New Show! Step out of the cold, and into the warm world of the arts, Greensboro -weâ€™re back, and the next two weeks feature a GPS alum and fan favorite, Jason Lord! Come see for yourself the artifacts on display of Jasonâ€™s thinking and tinkeringâ€¦ per usual, not to be missed! ğŸª€ğŸ—³ï¸ğŸ”´ğŸ”¹ğŸ˜€

NOW OPEN @ GPS

GHOST CHOIR
Solo Exhibition by Jason Lord 

On View January 13-24, 2026
Reception: Friday, Jan 23rd | 6-8p

Gallery Open Hours: 
Tuesday - Friday, 12-5p
Saturday, 2-5p

GHOST CHOIR is the convergence of a recurring image in my work and a studio practice that embraces the alter ego as generative disruption.

In the winter of 1996, in a moment of intense emotion, a sound came through me. What began as a wail became an emanation connecting the earthâ€™s core, through me, to every star and planet. The sound was so old and so large I didnâ€™t even try to claim it as my own, even as a self-centered 23-year-old. The sound was not from me, but it came through me, connecting me to everything and everyone, everywhere.

In and out of my studio, I experiment with rules. Sometimes I use alter egosâ€”embodied sets of rulesâ€”to push or disrupt certain predictable outcomes in my work. Each of these personae have a visual language and a mode of operation. This work is four of these studio personaeâ€”Otto, Santiago, Tammy, and Njezanâ€”making sense of the sound that came through me all those years ago, performing its song in four-part harmony, conducted by me.

NOW OPEN @ GPS

Childish Work

Group ExhibitionÂ 

Curated by Inga Manticas

On View December 9-13, 2025

Reception: Friday, Dec 12th | 6-8p

Gallery Open Hours:Â 

Tuesday - Friday, 12-5p

Saturday, 2-5p

Some of the artists in the show make work out of found objects taken directly from their childhoods, like dollhouses and Fisher Price TVs. Others paint with their fingers or draw scenes on Shrinky Dinks. Others emulate the graphic styles of coloring books and comics. Others attempt to recreate distant childhood memories. Others make works that reference the forms of toys and dolls: objects that could hypothetically be played with, but also demand closer observation and may even repel touch.Â 

Learn more by clicking â€œHappening Nowâ€ in the Linktree above in our profileÂ

events.title: ğŸ¨ advance_base & moontypo Concert
events.description:
advance_base & moontypo are coming back to Greensboro with local support from likewindowpanes on Wednesday, February 25th ğŸ‘¾ğŸ¶ğŸ¹

Doors at 7pm and music at 8pm // $12 suggested 

This is going to be a really sweet show. Weâ€™re super thrilled to have these folks back in Greensboro. If you missed Advance Base for his winter tour in 2024 or Moontype last summer, this is your chance to see them both with Greensboroâ€™s own, Panes. 

Advance Base is the melancholic soft rock recording project of Chicago, IL singer/songwriter Owen Ashworth (formerly of Casiotone for the Painfully Alone). Using a two-handed arsenal of electric piano, Omnichord, samplers, effect pedals & drum machines, Ashworth builds minimalist, heavy-hearted, nostalgia-obsessed ballads around his conversational baritone. The warm, electronic sound of Advance Base has been described as â€œlo-fi,â€ â€œdepressedâ€ & â€œweirdly uplifting.â€ Advance Base released Horrible Occurrences in 2024.

Moontype is songwriter Margaret McCarthyâ€™s dreamworld come to life. Based in Chicago, Illinois, the band features Emerson Hunton on drums, and Joe Suihkonen and Andrew Clinkman on guitar. Quiet emotions that McCarthy explores with her bass become, with the band, as large and as musically complex as a mood itself: cathartic, angsty, and unmet. Moontype released their debut album, Bodies of Water, in 2021 to critical acclaim.

panes is minimal introspective music with an engaging, dreamy listlessness. ever careening toward some kind of undiscovered self epiphany.

Flyer by: likewindowpanes

events.title: ğŸ¨ Death Circle
events.description:
ğ”‡ğ”¢ğ”ğ”±ğ”¥ â„­ğ”¦ğ”¯ğ” ğ”©ğ”¢, ğ”±ğ”¬ğ”¡ğ”ğ”¶ ğ”£ğ”¯ğ”¬ğ”ª 5 ğ”±ğ”¬ 7 ğ”“ğ” 

So many of us are carrying a lot right now. Personal losses, collective grief, the ache of what is happening in the world, and the grief we feel for our more-than-human kin and planet. We were never meant to carry any of this alone. What does it mean to live and die consciously? This circle is an offering to unburden ourselves in shared community and, in doing so, perhaps find more spaciousness and imaginative possibilities. 

Together we will co-create a sacred space to remember that these tender conversations about death, grief, cycles of change, and all of our connections in this web of existence once lived at the center of our communities. They are an integral part of our collective wellbeing. 

Death Circle is not a therapeutic setting or a grief support group, but an invitation to be present with one another as we explore these topics and reconnect more deeply with ourselves, each other, and the world around us. We welcome your curiosities, stories, questions, as well as your silence. There is no pressure to speak. All of it belongs ğŸ–¤

Our hope is that this offering fosters clarity, nurtures care, and deepens our relational intimacy. 

Death Circle will be held on the last Sunday of every month, from 5-7pm. Weâ€™ll have coffee and donuts, but feel free to bring your own snacks or any comfort items that support you.

We look forward to seeing you there â€” 
Joshua & Bri

events.title: ğŸ¨ Crisis Actress and Official Claire Music Performance
events.description:
â›“ï¸FRIDAY, OCTOBER 3rdâ›“ï¸DOORS at 8/SHOW at 9pm/$12 suggested/See ya at the show! ğŸ¤ 

Chicago-based crisis.actress_ crafts experimental pop that exists in perpetual evolution. At the heart of their sound are swirling keyboards, layered vocal harmonies, loops, and motorik guitar lines that propel their performances into unexplored territories. Guests are frequent, though the core ensemble includes Brooks Hannon on guitar and electronics, Max Hudson on synthesizers and vocals, Sam Pardo on bass and vocals, and Jake Keenum on drums. Their full-length debut, Return of the Puppet King, captures the bandâ€™s shared musical obsessions and commitment to experimentation. Recorded at the hatlowed Electrical Audio studio last fall, each track serves as a testament to their collective journey a dream realized through collaboration with countless talented friends who helped shape their vision.

officialclairemusic is one of Chicagoâ€™s finest new songwriters. She works with calm confession, deep wit, and the details of a poetâ€“ all on top of big, swaying hooks. The Chicago Reader praised her â€œincisive, witty lyricsâ€¦ a combination of sensitivity and straight talk.â€ Sheâ€™s also a calm shredder of guitarâ€“ both gritty and delicate.Â Claire grew up in the Chicagoland area. Her music caught the attention of former Wilco member, LeRoy Bach. Bach is a member of her live band, (as wellÂ asÂ Brooks HannonÂ &Â Jake KeenumÂ from Crisis Actress.) Official Claireâ€™s most recent studio offering, Midnight Dickbiter,features five remarkable new compositions.

mostly_mesh : Bass heavy post-punk darkwave with campy references to 80â€™s horror, BDSM tinged lyrics, and the processing of trauma. whiskeygingerrrr is hitting the road on their East Coast tour, bringing fresh tracks from their latest EP. Born in Boston and based in NYC, this indie/alternative rock band is known for explosive live performances and a magnetic stage presence that gets the crowd hooked âš¡ï¸âš¡ï¸

Joining the lineup are local indie favorites,  fmsnowmusic & burlapcircusband :

fmsnowmusic is a North Carolina-based indie rock band. FM Snow synthesizes everything from funk, math rock, folk, and back again.
Brainchild of musician and composer Cameron Rabb, the band blends shamelessly vulnerable lyrics with jazz-inspired chords, distorted guitars, and funky rhythms to create a truly unique sound. They seek to make odd rhythms groovy, make complexity approachable, and find joy in melancholy.

events.title: ğŸ¨ LEAF LITTER - â€˜Abalone Variation 1â€“6â€™ by KT Wilson
events.description:
Weâ€™re thrilled to spotlight a truly captivating series in our current exhibition, LEAF LITTERâ€”â€˜Abalone Variation 1â€“6â€™ by the talented artist KT Wilson. These original works are a celebration of the subtle, often overlooked wonders of nature, and we invite you to experience them in person at Irving Park Art & Frame.
Each piece in this series features a sustainably sourced abalone shell (pÄua) from the pristine waters of New Zealand. Revered for their iridescent beauty and cultural significance, New Zealand abalone shells are harvested under one of the worldâ€™s most robust sustainability systems, ensuring that their natural populations are protected for generations to come. These shells, considered â€˜taongaâ€™ (treasures) in MÄori culture, are not only a feast for the eyes but also a testament to the harmony of art and ecological responsibilityâ .
KT Wilsonâ€™s approach transforms each shell into a meditative focal point by mounting them in custom shadowbox frames. Rather than traditional fastenings, Wilson uses carefully woven textiles and thread to cradle each shell in place. This technique both secures the shell and highlights its natural form, color, and texture, drawing attention to the unique qualities of each specimen. The interplay between the organic shell and the geometric textile work invites viewers to contemplate the contrast and connection between the natural world and human creativity.
The â€˜Abalone Variationâ€™ series is a perfect fit for LEAF LITTER, our exhibition dedicated to the nuanced, often unnoticed aspects of nature. This show brings together artists whose work delves into the delicate, the intricate, and the ephemeralâ€”reminding us that beauty is often found in quiet details. KT Wilsonâ€™s pieces exemplify this ethos, offering viewers a chance to slow down and appreciate the subtle complexity of natural materials and thoughtful craft.
.
Visit us at Irving Park Art & Frame to see KT Wilsonâ€™s work and explore the full LEAF LITTER exhibition. Support local art, sustainable materials, and the ongoing conversation between human hands and the natural world.
.
.
.
#ArtExhibition #ContemporaryArt #NatureInspired #KTWilson #AbaloneArt #SustainableArt #PauaShel

events.title: ğŸµ Of Good Nature Live Performance
events.description:
ON SALE NOW!!!

Of Good Nature is a high-energy live band from Charlotte, NC, blending rock, soul,
reggae, and world music into a powerful, feel-good experience. Known for their
vibrant musicianship and irresistible grooves, the band delivers dynamic
performances rooted in real instruments, funky rhythms, and crowd connection. No
clicks, no tracks, just pure chemistry.

Hailing from Charlotte, classically trained violinist and songwriter Emanuel Wynter is taking ears and stages by storm with a distinctive sound and a lively, high-spirited stage presence that is infectious to everyone in the room. Taking influence from artists such as Anthony Hamilton, Leon Bridges, and Gary Clark Jr., Emanuelâ€™s sound is a unique, vibrant, and expressive blend of R&B and Rock that manages to be raw in emotion and refined, sonically. He finds a way to sing, not only through rich and soulful vocals, but through his electrifying violin playing that is, at times, quite reminiscent of electric guitar. With dynamic musicianship and sincere lyricism, Emanuel Wynter is sure to keep your toes tapping and your soul singing.

When Weâ€™re Sober is a genre-bending alt-rock band hailing from Greensboro, NC. Defined by a heavy grunge sound dripping with sonic energy, the band simultaneously explores diverse styles in their songwriting. Ranging from jangly pop-rock to heavy metal to folk-rock ballads, thereâ€™s few avenues the band wonâ€™t walk.

Taking influence from artists such as Anthony Hamilton, Leon Bridges, and Gary Clark Jr., Emanuelâ€™s sound is a unique, vibrant, and expressive blend of R&B and Rock that manages to be raw in emotion and refined, sonically. He finds a way to sing, not only through rich and soulful vocals, but through his electrifying violin playing that is, at times, quite reminiscent of electric guitar. With dynamic musicianship and sincere lyricism, Emanuel Wynter is sure to keep your toes tapping and your soul singing.

When Weâ€™re Sober is a genre-bending alt-rock band hailing from Greensboro, NC. Defined by a heavy grunge sound dripping with sonic energy, the band simultaneously explores diverse styles in their songwriting. Ranging from jangly pop-rock to heavy metal to folk-rock ballads, thereâ€™s few avenues the band wonâ€™t walk.

events.title: ğŸ¤ Underground Railroad Tour
events.description:
âœ¨ Last night we gathered at Guilford College for a tour through the land believed to have been a part of the Underground Railroad here in North Carolina. 

We walked as we listened to our guide and learned from the land and the trees.

If youâ€™re curious and want to learn more about this history, the trail is open to the public with information along the way (or you can book a tour with a guide!)

Our intention is more than reading side by side. We want you to connect with the people, spaces, and history that shape our community of Greensboro.

ğŸ“If you know a place we can visit, let us know. 

Thank you Liz and Guilford College for making this possible!

events.title: ğŸ¤ Release of Cele Fierro and Other Activists
events.description:
"On the morning of Tuesday, October 7, the Argentine Embassy in Tel Aviv reported that Israeli authorities would transfer our comrade Cele Fierro along with other activists from Ketziot prison to the Jordanian border for release.

Our comrade Cele, who was aboard the Adara, along with two other Argentines, will fly out of Jordan early in the morning of Wednesday, October 8 (local time), to arrive in Buenos Aires later that same night.

We are proud of Celeâ€™s internationalist militancy, putting her body on the line in the risky mission of the GSF, representing the MST of Argentina and the International Socialist League (ISL)." ligainternacionalsocialista cele_fierro

events.title: ğŸ¤ Trial of Alejandro Bodart
events.description:
Palestine solidarity is not a crime, solidarity with Alejandro Bodart. At the end of this month Argentine socialist, Alejandro Bodart will be on trial once again for his solidarity and support of the Palestinian people and their resistance to genocide. Bodartâ€™s trial is not only about Bodart, it is an international trend to criminalize any expression of solidarity with Palestine, while the State of Israel has murdered over 180,000 Palestinians. Greensboro Revolutionary Socialists stand in solidarity with Bordart and all those across the world resisting genocide. #absolucionparabodart
 Group of revolutionary socialists in Greensboro, NC and members of Tempest Collective @tempest_mag

events.title: ğŸ¤ Panel, Community Discussion and Organization Fair
events.description:
Come join the Coalition to Reject A MAGA America for a panel, community discussion and organization fair. Speakers from different local and international struggles will be speaking about their campaigns and organizational efforts to give local activists spaces where they can get involved in the struggle. A members Third Act will be speaking about how to stop the Transco SSEP pipeline, workers at REI and Reconsidered goods will be speaking on their unionization efforts, international speakers will be speaking on the struggles in Syria and Bangladesh, and activists in the October 22nd coalition will be speaking about the fight to end police violence. After the panel will be a community discussion followed by an organization fair where various different local orgs will have tables set up for participants to engage with. 
.

events.description:
Shout out to all the comrades and organizations that have been organizing this demonstration for months, thank you to all the comrades who raised their voices today against injustice and to call for unity in the community, in the class, and to call for solidarity. Today we just wanted to have a demonstration to tell the new administration that here in the Triad we are organized and that there is a resistance that will defend our rights and that if they touch one of us, we will all come out. We invite you, members of the community, whether you are part of an organization or not, who wants to collaborate, who is frustrated with what is happening and doesnâ€™t know how to help, who want to understand and get more information, we invite you to ORGANIZE yourself by getting in touch with us or any organization that best suits you. We also want to make a call to the organizations that want to do things together to join us, we must open the channels of communication and support each other. We have many different tasks but the adversary is the same and in the end the fight is also for the same thing. So letâ€™s organize, letâ€™s fight together!  Please stay tuned for the next events, actions etc.
